INGREDIENTS:


•Baby potatoes -15-20 very small potatoes
 •Onion - 2 finely chopped /1 cup
 •Tomatoes - 3 big and juicy ones 
 •Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tsp
 •Oil/Butter - 2 tbsp
 •Salt as required
 •Cashew nuts -5 (optional) 

•Oil for shallow frying potatoes


•Spice Powder: 

•Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
 •Chilli powder - 3/4 tsp
 •Coriander powder - 2 tsp
 •Cumin powder -3/4 tsp
 •Garam masala powder-1 tsp


For the seasoning : 

•Bay leaf -1
 •Jeera/Cumin seeds -1 tsp


For garnishing : 

•Coriander leaves
 •Julienne ginger(ginger cut into thin strips) 
 •Cream - 2 tbsp (optional) 


PREPARATION: 
 1.Parboil the potatoes (cook partially). Peel the skin, prick all over with a fork and shallow fry it till golden brown. Keep it aside. I used more than 15 potatoes as my potatoes were very small. 

2.Puree the tomatoes and keep it aside. You can also blanch tomatoes and then puree it. 

3.Soak cashew nuts in hot water and grind it to a fine paste. This is added to give richness to the gravy. 


METHOD: 

1.Heat oil/butter in a pan, add bay leaf, jeera seeds, when jeera sizzles, add finely chopped onions and saute until onions turn brown. Continuous stirring is required. You can add a little salt to speed up the process. 

2.Then add ginger-garlic paste and saute for a few more minutes. 

3.Add tomato puree, all the spice powder, salt needed and saute until tomatoes turn mushy and oil separates. You should not add water without cooking the tomatoes properly. 

4.Add cashew nut paste and cook for a few more minutes. 

5.Then add the shallow fried potatoes, 3/4 cup of water and cook covered for 6-10 minutes in low flame. 

6.Add cream (amul cream or dairy cream) if preferred. 

Garnish it with coriander leaves and thinly sliced ginger. 

Enjoy it hot with rotis,chapati, parathas, plain rice or any pulao (without tomato base).
